questions.question: Mitochondria are the powerhouses of the cell.
DNA is composed of four different nucleotide bases: adenine, cytosine, guanine, and thymine.
All living organisms are made up of cells.
Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert light energy into chemical energy.
The process of cell division in eukaryotic cells is called binary fission.
Enzymes are biological catalysts that speed up chemical reactions in cells.
Red blood cells have a nucleus.
The main function of white blood cells is to carry oxygen.
The human brain consists of three main parts: the cerebrum, cerebellum, and brainstem.
